Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway to the park keep flooding, 6th December
item.description:
The Y Buildings have recently been converted into flats. The council are apparently considering buying them. But please be aware that these two buildings have been built on part of a moat that was filled in a few years ago. Now the buildings have been converted into apartments, the builders have built a huge soak away into this part of the medieval moat. As you can see, now it’s been raining, the area is starting to flood and water pouring onto the pathway that leads to the park. I am further concerned that tax payers money will be wasted fixing all the flooding issues if Bromley Council buy these buildings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rafford Way, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain still blocked and pathway flooding, 6th December
item.description:
Dear all, I’ve been reporting this blocked drain for the last three years. Every time it rains the pathway floods. Please can the drain and cover be cleaned so that the waters captured and the pathway doesn’t keep flooding. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kentish Way, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway needs repairing as soon as possible, 6th December
item.description:
Please can the pathway be repaired as soon as possible so that people can continue to use the park. Unfortunately people are now avoiding the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please save our fish and dredge the lake, 6th December
item.description:
We have several fish in the lake, but we are running out of water. As you can see from the photos, the leaves have fallen on top of the silt, there’s only a couple of inches of water left for them. I just wanted to show you how bad it’s getting for them. And hope you’ll do something to help them. A suction dredge would be great due to the moat being hard bottomed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cuttings waiting for collection., 6th December
item.description:
Please can the cuttings, brambles, weeds etc be collected from outside of the wooden hut. We have piled them up there to save you driving into the park as you might get bogged down in the deep muddy ruts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wood, chicken wire, orange traffic cone, flytipped, 6th December
item.description:
Wooden planks, some wire (similar to chicken wire, but thicker) and an orange traffic cone were dumped by the composters. We have moved them to outside of the wooden hut so that you don’t have to drive to the composters to collect the fly tipped items. Please can you collect them from by the wooden hut. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: History and biodiversity trail information boards rotting, 6th December
item.description:
Information boards for the Bromley Heritage and Biodiversity are not fit for purpose. They were installed a few months ago and are starting to deteriorate already. Please can this be investigated as we are clearly not getting value for money. I was only allowed to add three photos. But it gives you a general idea that we didn’t get what we paid for! Please can the company replace all of them and this time treat the wood properly. They were fine in the good weather, but now the weather has changed they have rapidly deteriorated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
